    • Method Detail

      • importHref

        public static void importHref(String href)
        Inserts the appropriate <import> of a component given by url.
        Parameters:
        href - either an absolute url or a path relative to bower_components folder.

      • importHref

        public static void importHref(String href,
                              Function ok)
        Inserts the appropriate <import> of a component given by url.
        Parameters:
        href - either an absolute url or a path relative to bower_components folder.
        ok - callback to run in case of success

      • importHref

        public static void importHref(String hrefOrTag,
                              Function ok,
                              Function err)
        Inserts the appropriate <import> of a component given by url.
        Parameters:
        hrefOrTag - it can be an absolute url, a relative path or a tag name. - if it is a relative path, we prefix it with bower_components in case it is not already prefixed. - if it is a tag, we compose the relative url: bower_components/tagName/tagName.html
        ok - callback to run in case of success
        err - callback to run in case of failure

      • importHref

        public static void importHref(List<String> hrefs)
        Inserts the appropriate <import> of a list of components
        Parameters:
        hrefs - a list of absolute urls or relative paths to load.

      • importHref

        public static void importHref(List<String> hrefs,
                              Function ok)
        Inserts the appropriate <import> of a list of components
        Parameters:
        hrefs - a list of absolute urls or relative paths to load.
        ok - callback to run in case of all import success
        err - callback to run in case of failure

      • importHref

        public static void importHref(List<String> hrefs,
                              Function ok,
                              Function err)
        Inserts the appropriate <import> of a list of components
        Parameters:
        hrefs - a list of absolute urls or relative paths to load.
        ok - callback to run in case of all import success
        err - callback to run in case of failure

      • createElement

        public static <T> T createElement(String tagName,
                                  String... imports)
        Returns a new instance of the Element. It loads the web component from the bower_components/src url if it was not loaded yet.

      • ensureCustomElement

        public static <T> void ensureCustomElement(T elem,
                                           String... imports)

      • createElement

        public static <T> T createElement(String tagName)
        Returns a new instance of the Element. It loads the web component from the bower_components/tagName/tagName.html url if not loaded yet.

      • startLoading

      • endLoading

        public static void endLoading(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element container,
                              com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element webcomponent)

      • endLoading

        public static void endLoading(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element container,
                              com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element webcomponent,
                              Function func)
        Utility method to remove a loading message and show a container when a web component becomes available.
        Parameters:
        container - : The container to show when the component is available
        webcomponent - : Web component to monitor
        callback - : Calback function

      • asList

        public static <T> List<T> asList(com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject o)
        Box a native JS array in a Java List. It does not have any performance penalty because we directly set the native array of the super ArrayList implementation.

      • asJsArray

        public static <T extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject> com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArray<T> asJsArray(List<?> l)
        UnBox the native JS array in a Java List. It does not have any performance penalty because we directly take the native array of the super ArrayList implementation.
